meanings.definition: Improvs: plural noun meaning improvised performances or scenes in theater
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actors surprised the audience with their clever improvs.
meanings.sent2: The improv group received a standing ovation for their hilarious performance.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected improvs by the actors left everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a series of improvs, always unpredictable and exciting.
meanings.sent5: The improv comedy show was full of laughter and creativity.

meanings.definition: Improvs: verb meaning to create or perform spontaneously without preparation
meanings.sent1: She improvs her lines during the audition and impressed the director.
meanings.sent2: The talented musician improvs on his guitar during live performances.
meanings.sent3: He improvs a funny song about his cat on the spot.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to improvs in any situation makes her a great leader.
meanings.sent5: The chef improvs a new dish using leftover ingredients.
